title: Interaction Specification Template
description: An interactive p5.js visualization showing the three-part structure of well-specified interactions: Trigger, Response, and Feedback. Demonstrates how to document user interactions for educational simulations.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Interaction Design
User Experience
Instructional Design
Educational Technology
MicroSim Development
coverage: Foundational interaction design concept applicable to educational simulation development and UX specification
audience: Instructional designers, educators, and developers creating interactive educational simulations
learningObjective: Students will be able to structure interaction specifications using a consistent template that ensures completeness
learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of interaction specification template
Explore interaction specification template through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of interaction specification template to solve problems
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on interaction specification template
